intro: Mandevilla splendens, commonly known as the flame vine, is a tropical vine native to South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and can grow up to 15 feet in length if supported by a trellis or fence. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Mandevilla splendens is also known for its ability to bloom throughout the growing season, especially with regular pruning and fertilization.
